keyMoments.title: Camus Debuts as Fake Rebel
keyMoments.description: Camus and his three companions are introduced posing as Rebel Army soldiers protecting Ido village in exchange for food and shelter.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces the central character of this filler episode and establishes his fraudulent nature.
keyMoments.quote: We are members of the Rebel Army, here to protect this village from bandits!

keyMoments.title: Camus Remembers His Childhood Heroes
keyMoments.description: Camus recalls his childhood admiration for Chaka and Pell, realizing that the village children now look up to him the same way.
keyMoments.significance: Provides the emotional motivation for Camus's transformation from conman to genuine hero.
keyMoments.quote: These children... they look at me the way I used to look at Chaka and Pell. I can't let them down!

keyMoments.title: Camus Chooses Heroism Over Safety
keyMoments.description: Despite being terrified and outmatched, Camus decides to stand and fight Luffy to protect his reputation and the children's dreams.
keyMoments.significance: Marks Camus's character transformation from selfish fraud to someone willing to risk his life for others.
keyMoments.quote: I would rather die a hero to these children than ruin their dreams!

keyMoments.title: Camus Punches Luffy
keyMoments.description: Camus manages to land a punch on Luffy that knocks him backwards, demonstrating his resolve despite limited combat ability.
keyMoments.significance: Shows that courage and determination matter more than raw power.

distinctiveFeatures: Beige vest with brown shoulder pads

personality: Initially self-serving and cowardly, Camus undergoes character growth when confronted with the expectations of children who admire him. He transforms from a conman into someone willing to risk his life to protect others and maintain the heroic image the village children have of him.

abilities.description: Camus has moderate combat strength, capable of landing a punch that can knock Luffy backwards, though he is far from being a skilled fighter.

relationships.description: Vivi recognizes Camus as a fraud but tests him to see if he has genuine courage to protect the village.

evolutionMoments.description: Vivi decides to test Camus's resolve rather than immediately exposing him as a fraud.

relationships.description: Luffy challenges Camus to prove his worth as a protector of the village.

evolutionMoments.description: Luffy confronts Camus, forcing him to choose between running or fighting.

reveals.information: Camus grew up admiring Chaka and Pell, the guardian spirits of Alabasta
Camus is willing to risk his life to protect children's dreams and ideals

notes: Camus is an anime-only character who appears in this filler episode. He makes a brief cameo in Episode 130.

keyMoments.title: Vivi's Diplomatic Test
keyMoments.description: Vivi chooses to test Camus's courage rather than expose him as a fraud, showing her wisdom and understanding of human nature.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Vivi's growth as a leader who understands that actions matter more than origins.
keyMoments.quote: Let's test them. If they truly care about protecting this village, they'll prove it.

reveals.information: Vivi demonstrates diplomatic wisdom by testing Camus rather than exposing him

notes: This episode showcases Vivi's diplomatic skills and her understanding that people should be judged by their intentions and actions.

name.japanese: ポートガス・D・エース

keyMoments.title: Ace Arrives at Ido
keyMoments.description: Ace arrives at Ido village on his giant gecko and immediately starts eating the villagers' food, continuing his pursuit of Luffy.
keyMoments.significance: Continues the filler subplot of Ace accompanying the Straw Hats through the desert.

keyMoments.title: Ace Defeats Villagers
keyMoments.description: When called a food thief, Ace easily defeats the villagers and overwhelms Camus, demonstrating his overwhelming power.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the vast gap between Ace's strength and ordinary people, providing comic relief.

notes: Ace's extended presence in the desert is anime-only filler. In the manga, he left immediately after giving Luffy his Vivre Card.
